items.name: Ext.draw.engine.Canvas
items.text: Provides specific methods to draw with 2D Canvas element.

items.name: background
items.text: Background sprite config of the surface.

items.name: bind
controller
defaultListenerScope
items.text: If `true`, this component will be the default scope (this pointer) for events specified with string names so that the scope can be dynamically resolved. The component will automatically become the defaultListenerScope if a controller is specified. See the introductory docs for Ext.container.Container for some sample usages. **NOTE**: This value can only be reliably set at construction time. Setting it after that time may not correctly rewire all of the potentially effected listeners.

items.name: dirty
items.text: Indicates whether the surface needs to redraw.

items.name: flipRtlText
items.text:
If the surface is in the RTL mode, text will render with the RTL direction,
but the alignment and position of the text won't change by default.
Setting this config to 'true' will get text alignment and its position
within a surface mirrored.

items.name: height
items.text: The height of this Component; must be a valid CSS length value, e.g: `300`, `100px`, `30%`, etc. By default, if this is not explicitly set, this Component's element will simply have its own natural size. If set to `auto`, it will set the width to null meaning it will have its own natural size.

items.name: highPrecision
items.text:
True to have the Canvas use JavaScript Number instead of single precision floating point for transforms.

For example, when using data with big numbers to plot line series, the transformation
matrix of the canvas will have big elements. Due to the implementation of the SVGMatrix,
the elements are represented by 32-bits floats, which will work incorrectly.
To compensate for that, we enable the canvas context to perform all the transformations
in JavaScript.

Do not use this if you are not encountering 32-bit floating point errors problem,
since this will result in a performance penalty.

items.name: items
items.text: Array of sprite instances.

items.name: listeners
publishes
rect
items.text: The [x, y, width, height] rect of the surface related to its container.

items.name: reference
items.text: Specifies a name for this component inside its component hierarchy. This name must be unique within its Ext.container.Container#referenceHolder or its Ext.app.ViewController. See the documentation in Ext.container.Container for more information about references. **Note**: Valid identifiers start with a letter or underscore and are followed by zero or more additional letters, underscores or digits. References are case sensitive.

items.name: session
style
items.text:
Additional CSS styles that will be rendered into an inline style attribute when
the widget is rendered.

You can pass either a string syntax:

    style: 'background:red'

Or by using an object:

    style: {
        background: 'red'
    }

When using the object syntax, you can define CSS Properties by using a string:

    style: {
        'border-left': '1px solid red'
    }

Although the object syntax is much easier to read, we suggest you to use the
string syntax for better performance.

items.name: twoWayBindable
items.text: This object holds a map of `config` properties that will update their binding as they are modified. For example, `value` is a key added by form fields. The form of this config is the same as publishes. This config is defined so that updaters are not created and added for all bound properties since most cannot be modified by the end-user and hence are not appropriate for two-way binding.

items.name: userCls
items.text:
One or more CSS classes to add to the component's primary element. This config
is intended solely for use by the component instantiator (the "user"), not by
derived classes.

For example:

     items: [{
         xtype: 'button',
         userCls: 'my-button'
     ...
     }]

items.name: viewModel
items.text: The `ViewModel` is a data provider for this component and its children. The data contained in the `ViewModel` is typically used by adding bind configs to the components that want present or edit this data. When set, the `ViewModel` is created and links to any inherited viewModel instance from an ancestor container as the "parent". The `ViewModel` hierarchy, once established, only supports creation or destruction of children. The parent of a `ViewModel` cannot be changed on the fly. If this is a root-level `ViewModel`, the data model connection is made to this component's associated Ext.data.Session. This is determined by calling `getInheritedSession`.

items.name: width
items.text: The width of this Component; must be a valid CSS length value, e.g: `300`, `100px`, `30%`, etc. By default, if this is not explicitly set, this Component's element will simply have its own natural size. If set to `auto`, it will set the width to null meaning it will have its own natural size.

items.name: _addDeclaredListeners
items.text: Adds declarative listeners as nested arrays of listener objects.
`true` if any listeners were added

items.name: add
addAfterListener
items.text: Alias for onAfter.

items.name: addBeforeListener
items.text: Alias for onBefore.

items.name: addBindableUpdater
items.text:
Ensures that the given property (if it is a Config System config) has a proper
"updater" method on this instance to sync changes to the config.

items.name: property
items.text: The name of the config property.

items.name: addDelegatedListener
items.text: Adds a listeners with the "delegate" event option. Users should not invoke this method directly. Use the "delegate" event option of Ext.util.Observable#addListener instead.

items.name: addElementReference
items.text: Adds an element reference to this Widget instance.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the reference

items.name: addElementReferenceOnDemand
items.text:
Reduces instantiation time for a Widget by lazily instantiating Ext.Element
references the first time they are used.  This optimization only works for elements
with no listeners specified.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the reference

items.name: addListener
eventName
items.text:
The name of the event to listen for.
May also be an object who's property names are event names.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes or the *name* of the method within the specified `scope`. Will be called with arguments given to Ext.util.Observable#fireEvent plus the `options` parameter described below.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: options
items.text:
An object containing handler configuration.

**Note:** The options object will also be passed as the last argument to every
event handler.

This object may contain any of the following properties:

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is executed. **If omitted,
  defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: delay
items.text:
The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after the event
  fires.

items.name: single
items.text:
True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove
  itself.

items.name: buffer
items.text: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is _not_ invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

items.name: onFrame
items.text: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run at the next Ext.Function#requestAnimationFrame. If the event fires again before that time, the handler is not rescheduled - the handler will only be called once when the next animation frame is fired, with the last set of arguments passed.

items.name: target
items.text:
Only call the handler if the event was fired on the target Observable, _not_ if the
  event was bubbled up from a child Observable.

items.name: element
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.Component.** The name of a Component property which references an Ext.dom.Element to add a listener to. This option is useful during Component construction to add DOM event listeners to elements of Ext.Component which will exist only after the Component is rendered. For example, to add a click listener to a Panel's body: var panel = new Ext.panel.Panel({ title: 'The title', listeners: { click: this.handlePanelClick, element: 'body' } }); In order to remove listeners attached using the element, you'll need to reference the element itself as seen below. panel.body.un(...)

items.name: delegate
items.text:
A simple selector to filter the event target or look for a descendant of the target.

  The "delegate" option is only available on Ext.dom.Element instances (or
  when attaching a listener to a Ext.dom.Element via a Component using the
  element option).

  See the *delegate* example below.

items.name: stopPropagation
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.dom.Element.** `true` to call Ext.event.Event#stopPropagation on the event object before firing the handler.

items.name: preventDefault
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.dom.Element.** `true` to call Ext.event.Event#preventDefault on the event object before firing the handler.

items.name: stopEvent
items.text: **This option is only valid for listeners bound to Ext.dom.Element.** `true` to call Ext.event.Event#stopEvent on the event object before firing the handler.

items.name: args
items.text: Optional arguments to pass to the handler function. Any additional arguments passed to Ext.util.Observable#fireEvent will be appended to these arguments.

items.name: destroyable
items.text: When specified as `true`, the function returns a `destroyable` object. An object which implements the destroy method which removes all listeners added in this call. This syntax can be a helpful shortcut to using un; particularly when removing multiple listeners. *NOTE* - not compatible when using the _element_ option. See un for the proper syntax for removing listeners added using the _element_ config.

items.name: priority
items.text:
An optional numeric priority that determines the order in which event handlers
  are run. Event handlers with no priority will be run as if they had a priority
  of 0. Handlers with a higher priority will be prioritized to run sooner than
  those with a lower priority.  Negative numbers can be used to set a priority
  lower than the default. Internally, the framework uses a range of 1000 or
  greater, and -1000 or lesser for handlers that are intended to run before or
  after all others, so it is recommended to stay within the range of -999 to 999
  when setting the priority of event handlers in application-level code.
  A priority must be an integer to be valid.  Fractional values are reserved for
  internal framework use.

items.name: order
items.text:
A legacy option that is provided for backward compatibility.
  It is recommended to use the `priority` option instead.  Available options are:

  - `'before'`: equal to a priority of `100`
  - `'current'`: equal to a priority of `0` or default priority
  - `'after'`: equal to a priority of `-100`

items.name: order
addManagedListener
item
items.text: The item to which to add a listener/listeners.

items.name: ename
items.text: The event name, or an object containing event name properties.

items.name: fn
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event
name, this is the handler function or the name of a method on the specified
`scope`.

items.name: scope
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the scope (`this` reference)
in which the handler function is executed.

items.name: options
items.text: (optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the Ext.util.Observable#addListener options.

items.name: appendPath
items.text: Uses the given path commands to begin a new path on the canvas.

items.name: applySession
items.text: Transforms a Session config to a proper instance.

items.name: applyViewModel
items.text: Transforms a ViewModel config to a proper instance.

items.name: clearDelegatedListeners
items.text: Clears all listeners that were attached using the "delegate" event option. Users should not invoke this method directly. It is called automatically as part of normal Ext.util.Observable#clearListeners processing.

items.name: clearListeners
items.text: Removes all listeners for this object including the managed listeners

items.name: clearManagedListeners
items.text: Removes all managed listeners for this object.

items.name: constructor
items.text: Creates new Object.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to wrap.

items.name: createCanvas
items.text: Creates the canvas element.

items.name: createItem
items.text: Creates an item and appends it to the surface. Called as an internal method when calling add.

items.name: createRelayer
items.text: Creates an event handling function which re-fires the event from this object as the passed event name.

items.name: newName
items.text: The name under which to re-fire the passed parameters.

items.name: beginEnd
items.text: (optional) The caller can specify on which indices to slice.

items.name: destroy
items.text:
Destroys the surface. This is done by removing all components from it and
also removing its reference to a DOM element.

For example:

     drawContainer.surface.destroy();

items.name: disablePrecisionCompensation
items.text: Clears canvas of compensation for canvas' use of single precision floating point.

items.name: ctx
items.text: The canvas context.

items.name: doFireDelegatedEvent
items.text: Fires a delegated event. Users should not invoke this method directly. It is called automatically by the framework as needed (see the "delegate" event option of Ext.util.Observable#addListener for more details.

items.name: doFireEvent
items.text: Continue to fire event.

items.name: ellipse
items.text:
Adds points to the subpath such that the arc described by the circumference of the
ellipse described by the arguments, starting at the given start angle and ending at
the given end angle, going in the given direction (defaulting to clockwise), is added
to the path, connected to the previous point by a straight line.

items.name: enableBubble
eventNames
items.text: The event name to bubble, or an Array of event names.

items.name: enablePrecisionCompensation
items.text: Compensate for canvas' use of single precision floating point.

items.name: ctx
items.text: The canvas context.

items.name: fill
items.text: Fills the subpaths of the current default path or the given path with the current fill style.

items.name: fireAction
items.text: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters and executes a function (action). By default, the action function will be executed after any "before" event handlers (as specified using the `order` option of Ext.util.Observable#addListener), but before any other handlers are fired. This gives the "before" handlers an opportunity to cancel the event by returning `false`, and prevent the action function from being called. The action can also be configured to run after normal handlers, but before any "after" handlers (as specified using the `order` event option) by passing `'after'` as the `order` parameter. This configuration gives any event handlers except for "after" handlers the opportunity to cancel the event and prevent the action function from being called.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Arguments to pass to handlers and to the action function.

items.name: fn
items.text: The action function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: options
items.text: Event options for the action function. Accepts any of the options of Ext.util.Observable#addListener

items.name: order
items.text: The order to call the action function relative too the event handlers (`'before'` or `'after'`). Note that this option is simply used to sort the action function relative to the event handlers by "priority". An order of `'before'` is equivalent to a priority of `99.5`, while an order of `'after'` is equivalent to a priority of `-99.5`. See the `priority` option of Ext.util.Observable#addListener for more details.

items.name: fireEvent
items.text: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name, plus the `options` object passed to Ext.util.Observable#addListener). An event may be set to bubble up an Observable parent hierarchy (See Ext.Component#getBubbleTarget) by calling enableBubble.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers.
returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true.

items.name: fireEventArgs
items.text: Fires the specified event with the passed parameter list. An event may be set to bubble up an Observable parent hierarchy (See Ext.Component#getBubbleTarget) by calling enableBubble.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: An array of parameters which are passed to handlers.
returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true.

items.name: fireEventedAction
items.text:
Fires the specified event with the passed parameters and executes a function (action).
Evented Actions will automatically dispatch a 'before' event passing. This event will
be given a special controller that allows for pausing/resuming of the event flow.

By pausing the controller the updater and events will not run until resumed. Pausing,
however, will not stop the processing of any other before events.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Arguments to pass to handlers and to the action function.

items.name: fn
items.text: The action function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: fnArgs
items.text:
Optional arguments for the action `fn`. If not
given, the normal `args` will be used to call `fn`. If `false` is passed, the
`args` are used but if the first argument is this instance it will be removed
from the args passed to the action function.

items.name: fixReference
items.text: Sets up a reference on our current reference holder.

items.name: flatten
items.text:
Flattens the given drawing surfaces into a single image
and returns an object containing the data (in the DataURL format)
and the type (e.g. 'png' or 'svg') of that image.

items.name: size
items.text: The size of the final image.

items.name: surfaces
items.text: The surfaces to flatten.

items.name: data
items.text: The DataURL of the flattened image.

items.name: type
items.text: The type of the image.

items.name: get
items.text:
Get the sprite by id or index.
It will first try to find a sprite with the given id, otherwise will try to use the id as an index.

items.name: getBBox
items.text: Return the minimal bounding box that contains all the sprites bounding boxes in the given list of sprites.
{{x: Number, y: Number, width: number, height: number}}

items.name: getBubbleParent
items.text: Gets the bubbling parent for an Observable
The bubble parent. null is returned if no bubble target exists

items.name: getController
items.text: Returns the Ext.app.ViewController instance associated with this component via the controller config or setController method.

Returns this component's ViewController or
null if one was not configured

items.name: getElementConfig
items.text: A template method for modifying the element config before it is processed. By default adds the result of `this.getTemplate()` as the `children` array of element if `children` were not specified in the original element config. Typically this method should not need to be implemented in subclasses. Instead the element property should be use to configure the element template for a given Widget subclass. This method is called once when the first instance of each Widget subclass is created. The element config object that is returned is cached and used as the template for all successive instances. The scope object for this method is the class prototype, not the instance.
the element config object

items.name: getId
items.text: Retrieves the id of this component. Will autogenerate an id if one has not already been set.
id

items.name: getInherited
items.text: This method returns an object containing the inherited properties for this instance.

items.name: inner
items.text:
Pass `true` to return `inheritedStateInner` instead
of the normal `inheritedState` object. This is only needed internally and should
not be passed by user code.
The `inheritedState` object containing inherited properties.

items.name: getInheritedConfig
items.text:
This method returns the value of a config property that may be inherited from some
ancestor.

In some cases, a config may be explicitly set on a component with the intent of
*only* being presented to its children while that component should act upon the
inherited value (see `referenceHolder` for example). In these cases the `skipThis`
parameter should be specified as `true`.

items.name: property
items.text: The name of the config property to return.

items.name: skipThis
items.text:
Pass `true` if the property should be ignored if
found on this instance. In other words, `true` means the property must be inherited
and not explicitly set on this instance.
The value of the requested `property`.

items.name: getRefOwner
items.text: Used by Ext.ComponentQuery, and the Ext.Component#up method to find the owning Component in the linkage hierarchy. By default this returns the Container which contains this Component. This may be overridden by Component authors who implement ownership hierarchies which are not based upon ownerCt, such as BoundLists being owned by Fields or Menus being owned by Buttons.

items.name: getSize
items.text: Returns the height and width of the Component.
The current height and width of the Component.

items.name: getTdCls
items.text: Needed for when widget is rendered into a grid cell. The class to add to the cell element.

items.name: getTdType
items.text: Partner method to getTdCls. Returns the base type for the component. Defaults to return `this.xtype`, but All derived classes of Ext.form.field.Text can return the type 'textfield', and all derived classes of Ext.button.Button can return the type 'button'

items.name: hasListener
items.text:
Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event, or whether the event bubbles. The answer
indicates whether the event needs firing or not.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to check for
`true` if the event is being listened for or bubbles, else `false`

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: hitTest
items.text: Performs a hit test on all sprites in the surface, returning the first matching one.

items.name: point
items.text: A two-item array containing x and y coordinates of the point.

items.name: options
items.text: Hit testing options.

A hit result object that contains more information about what
exactly was hit or null if nothing was hit.

items.name: hitTestEvent
items.text: Performs a hit test on all sprites in the surface, returning the first matching one. Since hit testing is typically performed on mouse events, this convenience method converts event's page coordinates to surface coordinates before calling hitTest.

items.name: point
items.text: An event object.

items.name: options
items.text: Hit testing options.

A hit result object that contains more information about what
exactly was hit or null if nothing was hit.

items.name: initBindable
items.text: This method triggers the lazy configs and must be called when it is time to fully boot up. The configs that must be initialized are: bind, publishes, session, twoWayBindable and viewModel.

items.name: initElement
items.text: Initializes the Element for this Widget instance. If this is the first time a Widget of this type has been instantiated the element config will be processed to create an Element. This Element is then cached on the prototype (see afterCachedConfig) so that future instances can obtain their element by simply cloning the Element that was cached by the first instance.

items.name: initElementListeners
initInheritedState
items.text:
This method is called to initialize the `inheritedState` objects for this instance.
This amounts to typically copying certain properties from the instance to the given
object.

items.name: inheritedState
items.text: The state object for this instance.

items.name: inheritedStateInner
items.text: This object is only provided for containers.

items.name: invalidateInheritedState
items.text: This method marks the current inherited state as invalid. The next time a call is made to getInherited the objects will be recreated and initialized.

items.name: is
items.text: Tests whether this Widget matches a Ext.ComponentQuery selector string.

items.name: selector
items.text: The selector string to test against.
`true` if this Widget matches the selector.

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: isSuspended
items.text: Checks if all events, or a specific event, is suspended.

items.name: event
items.text: The name of the specific event to check
`true` if events are suspended

items.name: isSyncing
items.text: Checks if a particular binding is synchronizing the value.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the property being bound to.
`true` if the binding is syncing.

items.name: isXType
items.text: Tests whether or not this Component is of a specific xtype. This can test whether this Component is descended from the xtype (default) or whether it is directly of the xtype specified (`shallow = true`). **If using your own subclasses, be aware that a Component must register its own xtype to participate in determination of inherited xtypes.__ For a list of all available xtypes, see the Ext.Component header. Example usage: var t = new Ext.field.Text(); var isText = t.isXType('textfield'); // true var isBoxSubclass = t.isXType('field'); // true, descended from Ext.field.Field var isBoxInstance = t.isXType('field', true); // false, not a direct Ext.field.Field instance

items.name: xtype
items.text: The xtype to check for this Component.

items.name: shallow
items.text:
(optional) `false` to check whether this Component is descended from the xtype (this is
the default), or `true` to check whether this Component is directly of the specified xtype.
`true` if this component descends from the specified xtype, `false` otherwise.

items.name: lookupController
items.text:
Gets the controller that controls this view. May be a controller that belongs
to a view higher in the hierarchy.

items.name: skipThis
items.text:
`true` to not consider the controller directly attached
to this view (if it exists).
The controller. null if no controller is found.

items.name: lookupReferenceHolder
items.text: Gets the Controller or Component that is used as the reference holder for this view.

items.name: skipThis
items.text: `false` to return this as the reference holder if this instance has set `referenceHolder`. Unlike getInheritedConfig this method defaults to `true` because it is possible that a reference property set by the owner of a component that is also a `referenceHolder` itself. In this case, the reference connects not to this component but to the parent referenceHolder.
The reference holder.

items.name: lookupSession
items.text: Returns the Ext.data.Session for this instance. This property may come from this instance's session or be inherited from this object's parent.

items.name: skipThis
items.text: Pass `true` to ignore a session configured on this instance and only consider an inherited session.

items.name: lookupViewModel
items.text: Returns the Ext.app.ViewModel for this instance. This property may come from this this instance's viewModel or be inherited from this object's parent.

items.name: skipThis
items.text: Pass `true` to ignore a viewModel configured on this instance and only consider an inherited view model.

items.name: makeBindableUpdater
items.text: Returns an `update` method for the given Config that will call publishState to ensure two-way bindings (via bind) as well as any publishes are updated. This method is cached on the `cfg` instance for re-use.
The updater function.

items.name: mon
items.text: Shorthand for addManagedListener.

items.name: mun
items.text: Shorthand for removeManagedListener.

items.name: onAdd
items.text: Invoked when a sprite is added to the surface.

items.name: sprite
items.text: The sprite to be added.

items.name: onAfter
items.text: Appends an after-event handler. Same as Ext.util.Observable#addListener with `order` set to `'after'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to listen for.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: An object containing handler configuration.

items.name: onBefore
items.text: Appends a before-event handler. Returning `false` from the handler will stop the event. Same as Ext.util.Observable#addListener with `order` set to `'before'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to listen for.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: An object containing handler configuration.

items.name: onInheritedAdd
items.text: Called when this Inheritable is added to a parent

items.name: onInheritedRemove
items.text: Called when this inheritable is removed from a parent

items.name: destroying
items.text: `true` if this item will be destroyed by it's container

items.name: orderByZIndex
items.text: Order the items by their z-index if any of that has been changed since last sort.

items.name: processElementConfig
items.text:
Recursively processes the element templates for this class and its superclasses,
ascending the hierarchy until it reaches a superclass whose element template
has already been processed.  This method is invoked using the prototype as the scope.

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: publishState
items.text: Publish this components state to the `ViewModel`. If no arguments are given (or if this is the first call), the entire state is published. This state is determined by the publishes property. This method is called only by component authors.

items.name: property
items.text: The name of the property to update.

items.name: value
items.text: The value of `property`. Only needed if `property` is given.

items.name: relayEvents
items.text:
Relays selected events from the specified Observable as if the events were fired by `this`.

For example if you are extending Grid, you might decide to forward some events from store.
So you can do this inside your initComponent:

    this.relayEvents(this.getStore(), ['load']);

The grid instance will then have an observable 'load' event which will be passed
the parameters of the store's load event and any function fired with the grid's
load event would have access to the grid using the this keyword (unless the event
is handled by a controller's control/listen event listener in which case 'this'
will be the controller rather than the grid).

items.name: origin
items.text: The Observable whose events this object is to relay.

items.name: events
items.text:
Array of event names to relay or an Object with key/value
pairs translating to ActualEventName/NewEventName respectively. For example:
    this.relayEvents(this, {add:'push', remove:'pop'});

Would now redispatch the add event of this as a push event and the remove event as a pop event.

items.name: prefix
remove
sprite
items.text: A sprite instance or its ID.

items.name: isDestroy
items.text: If `true`, the sprite will be destroyed.
Returns the removed/destroyed sprite or null otherwise.

items.name: removeAfterListener
items.text: Alias for unAfter.

items.name: removeAll
removeBeforeListener
items.text: Alias for unBefore.

items.name: removeDelegatedListener
items.text: Removes delegated listeners for a given eventName, function, and scope. Users should not invoke this method directly. It is called automatically by the framework as part of removeListener processing.

items.name: removeListener
items.text: Removes an event handler.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The type of event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove. **This must be a reference to the function passed into the Ext.util.Observable#addListener call.**

items.name: scope
removeManagedListener
items.text: Removes listeners that were added by the mon method.

items.name: item
items.text: The item from which to remove a listener/listeners.

items.name: ename
items.text: The event name, or an object containing event name properties.

items.name: fn
items.text: (optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the handler function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the scope (`this` reference)
in which the handler function is executed.

items.name: removeManagedListenerItem
items.text: Remove a single managed listener item

items.name: isClear
items.text: True if this is being called during a clear

items.name: managedListener
items.text:
The managed listener item
See removeManagedListener for other args

items.name: renderFrame
items.text: Triggers the re-rendering of the canvas.

items.name: renderSprite
items.text: Renders a single sprite into the surface. Do not call it from outside renderFrame method.

items.name: sprite
items.text: The Sprite to be rendered.
returns `false` to stop the rendering to continue.

items.name: repaint
items.text: Force the element to redraw.

items.name: resetTransform
items.text: Reset the matrix of the surface.

items.name: resolveListenerScope
items.text:
Gets the default scope for firing late bound events (string names with
no scope attached) at runtime.

items.name: defaultScope
items.text: The default scope to return if none is found.
The default event scope

items.name: resolveSatelliteListenerScope
items.text:
Returns the default listener scope for a "satellite" of this component.
Used for resolving scope for observable objects that are not part of the normal
Container/Component hierarchy (for example, plugins)
The listener scope

items.name: resumeEvent
items.text: Resumes firing of the named event(s). After calling this method to resume events, the events will fire when requested to fire. **Note that if the suspendEvent method is called multiple times for a certain event, this converse method will have to be called the same number of times for it to resume firing.**

items.name: eventName
items.text: Multiple event names to resume.

items.name: resumeEvents
items.text: Resumes firing events (see suspendEvents). If events were suspended using the `queueSuspended` parameter, then all events fired during event suspension will be sent to any listeners now.

items.name: discardQueue
items.text: `true` to prevent any previously queued events from firing while we were suspended. See suspendEvents.

items.name: roundPixel
items.text: Round the number to align to the pixels on device.

items.name: num
items.text: The number to align.
The resultant alignment.

items.name: setLineDash
items.text:
2D Canvas context in IE (up to IE10, inclusive) doesn't support
the setLineDash method and the lineDashOffset property.

items.name: dashList
items.text: An even number of non-negative numbers specifying a dash list.

items.name: setListeners
items.text: An alias for Ext.util.Observable#addListener. In versions prior to 5.1, listeners had a generated setter which could be called to add listeners. In 5.1 the listeners config is not processed using the config system and has no generated setter, so this method is provided for backward compatibility. The preferred way of adding listeners is to use the on method.

items.name: listeners
items.text: The listeners

items.name: setSize
items.text: Sets the size of the Component.

items.name: width
items.text: The new width for the Component.

items.name: height
items.text: The new height for the Component.

items.name: stroke
items.text: Strokes the subpaths of the current default path or the given path with the current stroke style.

items.name: suspendEvent
items.text: Suspends firing of the named event(s). After calling this method to suspend events, the events will no longer fire when requested to fire. **Note that if this is called multiple times for a certain event, the converse method resumeEvent will have to be called the same number of times for it to resume firing.**

items.name: eventName
items.text: Multiple event names to suspend.

items.name: suspendEvents
items.text: Suspends the firing of all events. (see resumeEvents)

items.name: queueSuspended
items.text: `true` to queue up suspended events to be fired after the resumeEvents call instead of discarding all suspended events.

items.name: toggleCls
items.text:
Toggles the specified CSS class on this element (removes it if it already exists,
otherwise adds it).

items.name: className
items.text: The CSS class to toggle.

items.name: state
items.text:
If specified as `true`, causes the class to be added. If
specified as `false`, causes the class to be removed.

items.name: toLocaleString
items.text: Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects for locale-specific purposes. Objects toLocaleString returns the result of calling toString. This function is provided to give objects a generic toLocaleString method, even though not all may use it. Currently, only Array, Number, and Date override toLocaleString.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString

items.text: Object represented as a string.

items.name: un
items.text: Shorthand for removeListener.

items.name: unAfter
items.text: Removes a before-event handler. Same as removeListener with `order` set to `'after'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope originally specified for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: Extra options object.

items.name: unBefore
items.text: Removes a before-event handler. Same as removeListener with `order` set to `'before'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text: The handler to remove.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope originally specified for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: Extra options object.

items.name: updateSession
items.text: Updates the session config.

items.name: updateViewModel
items.text: Updates the viewModel config.

items.name: valueOf
items.text: Returns the primitive value of the specified object. JavaScript calls the valueOf method to convert an object to a primitive value. You rarely need to invoke the valueOf method yourself; JavaScript automatically invokes it when encountering an object where a primitive value is expected. By default, the valueOf method is inherited by every object descended from Object. Every built- in core object overrides this method to return an appropriate value. If an object has no primitive value, valueOf returns the object itself, which is displayed as: [object Object] You can use valueOf within your own code to convert a built-in object into a primitive value. When you create a custom object, you can override `Object.valueOf` to call a custom method instead of the default Object method. You can create a function to be called in place of the default valueOf method. Your function must take no arguments. Suppose you have an object type `myNumberType` and you want to create a valueOf method for it. The following code assigns a user-defined function to the object's valueOf method: myNumberType.prototype.valueOf = new Function(functionText) With the preceding code in place, any time an object of type `myNumberType` is used in a context where it is to be represented as a primitive value, JavaScript automatically calls the function defined in the preceding code. An object's valueOf method is usually invoked by JavaScript, but you can invoke it yourself as follows: myNumber.valueOf() Note: Objects in string contexts convert via the toString method, which is different from String objects converting to string primitives using valueOf. All objects have a string conversion, if only `"[object type]"`. But many objects do not convert to number, boolean, or function.
Returns value of the object or the object itself.

items.name: waitFor
items.text: Mark the surface to render after another surface is updated.

items.name: surface
items.text: The surface to wait for.

items.name: $eventOptions
items.text: Matches options property names within a listeners specification object  - property names which are never used as event names.

items.name: clear
items.text: Empty the surface content (without touching the sprites.)

items.name: clearTransform
items.text: Clears the current transformation state on the surface.

items.name: constructor
defaultBindProperty
items.text: This property is used to determine the property of a bind config that is just the value. For example, if `defaultBindProperty="value"`, then this shorthand bind config: bind: '{name}' Is equivalent to this object form: bind: { value: '{name}' } The defaultBindProperty is set to "value" for form fields and to "store" for grids and trees.

items.name: devicePixelRatio
items.text:
The reported device pixel density.
devicePixelRatio is only supported from IE11,
so we use deviceXDPI and logicalXDPI that are supported from IE6.

items.name: element
eventsSuspended
items.text: Initial suspended call count. Incremented when suspendEvents is called, decremented when resumeEvents is called.

items.name: hasListeners
items.text: This object holds a key for any event that has a listener. The listener may be set directly on the instance, or on its class or a super class (via observe) or on the Ext.app.EventBus. The values of this object are truthy (a non-zero number) and falsy (0 or undefined). They do not represent an exact count of listeners. The value for an event is truthy if the event must be fired and is falsy if there is no need to fire the event. The intended use of this property is to avoid the expense of fireEvent calls when there are no listeners. This can be particularly helpful when one would otherwise have to call fireEvent hundreds or thousands of times. It is used like this: if (this.hasListeners.foo) { this.fireEvent('foo', this, arg1); }

items.name: isObservable
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Observable, or subclass thereof.

items.name: isPendingRenderFrame
items.text: This flag is used to indicate that `predecessors` surfaces that should render before this surface renders are dirty, and to call renderFrame when all `predecessors` have their renderFrame called (i.e. not dirty anymore). This flag indicates that current surface has surfaces that are yet to render before current surface can render. When all the `predecessors` surfaces have rendered, i.e. when `dirtyPredecessorCount` reaches zero,

items.name: prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.

items.name: template
items.text: An array of child elements to use as the children of the main element in the element template. Only used if "children" are not specified explicitly in the element template.

items.name: toSave
items.text: Properties to be saved/restored in the `save` and `restore` methods.

items.name: validRefRe
items.text: Regular expression used for validating reference values.
